title: Amazon holiday quarter sales forecast falls short of estimates
text:
Seattle | Amazon forecast fourth-quarter revenue below analysts' estimates as the world's biggest online retailer faces fierce competition from Walmart and other e-commerce players, sending its shares sharply lower.

The company forecast net sales in the range of $US80.0 billion ($US117 billion) to $US86.5 billion for the fourth quarter. Analysts were expecting revenue of $US87.37 billion, according to IBES data from Refinitiv.

Its shares were 7.6 per cent lower in after hours trading. The shares had advanced 1.1 per cent to $US1780.78 in regular trading in New York.

In a statement, Amazon said its guidance anticipates "an unfavourable impact of approximately 80 basis points from foreign exchange rates".

Operating income is expected to be between $US1.2 billion and $US2.9 billion, compared with $US3.8 billion in fourth quarter 2018.
description: The world's biggest online retailer faces fierce competition from Walmart and other e-commerce players.
